0.27 Nightly pre-builds for 0.27 (#2025)

* ci: 0.27-nightly pre-releases

* cmake: if CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD is not specified => use 98
Add more DNG 1.6 tags

0.27 Running tests with ctest (#2024)

* Use CTest for running unit_tests and system_tests

* ci: also use ctest on appveyor

* Simplify strError() unit tests to be platform agnostic
Treat Exif.Sony1.PreviewImage as undefined tag.

Merge pull request #2019 from Exiv2/ci_mingw_gha

Switch MinGW CI to GHA
Handle unused warnings

Initial MSYS2 workflow for GHA

Fix appveyor
Remove legacy MinGW CI builds

Fix conan ci luis (#2018)

* conan: update references to recipes and use new generators

* conan: update conan version on CI jobs

* ci: linux build with c++11 and no deprecation warnings

* cmake: increase cmake minimum version, consume gtest in standard way

* ci: upgrade conan on appveyor & travis CI files

* cmake: ignore warnings about missing PDB files

* ci: reduce CMake minimum version to 3.7.2

The reason to do that is that we still have Debian:9 and Ubuntu 18.04 on
the gitlab CI. That version of CMake is already providing the new &
improved way to find & use the GTest package.

* ci: delete gitlab pipeline and deprecated scripts

The gitlab pipeline was superseded by the Github actions:
nightly_linux_distributions

* ci: appveyor superseded by github actions

* ci: Use gtest 1.8.1 instead of 1.10.

Gtest 1.8.1 was the last release of Gtest compatible with pre-C++11
compilers

Merge pull request #2004 from Exiv2/slim_mingw_ci

Streamline MinGW package installation for CI
Added a sentence to `5.4 Cygwin/64` about `apt-cyg`.
Update README.md for pacman command simplification
Streamline MinGW package installation for CI

The Cygwin/CI is broken. (#2003)

* The Cygwin/CI is broken.  Try using cmake to build instead of make.

* Where's bash.exe?

* Bash is in c:\cygwin64\bin\bash.exe.  Modify CMD to report something meaningful.

* Run, rabbit, run.  (you've already seen what happened to the turkey!).

* Hunt for cmake.exe.  It was installed with `apt-cyg install cmake ...`

* cmake is in c:\Cygwin64\bin\cmake.exe which is /usr/bin/cmake.exe

* Request cmake v3.17.3 (which is what I use on the buildserver).

* Try 3.17.3.-2

* Query available versions of cmake.

* Build cmake from source.

* Can't build from source.  It simply stopped after 56 minutes.

* Try again!

* Yes another attempt to install a working cmake.

* I believe this now works.

* Some comment polishing.
